metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
Job Description: Sr. Competitive Marketing Analyst, Object and File Storage

We are looking for a Senior Competitive Marketing Analyst to cover our unstructured data portfolio including object, file and partner products to enable and support our sales organization in competitive situations. They will also provide key internal stakeholders with actionable and impactful competitive data, insights and recommendation to drive our current business and strategy.

Reporting to the Senior Director of Strategic Marketing, the Senior Competitive Marketing Analyst will research competitors, customer data and intelligence, market trends, technology, and other forces to position Hitachi Vantara with the greatest possible competitive advantage. This is a competitive intelligence position with a primary focus on our unstructured data portfolio including object storage, file storage and related partner products.  
Job Overview:
•	Provide analysis of competitor’s market activities including positioning, strengths/weaknesses, competitive tactics and responses for field sales use. Deliver key insights and recommendations through battlecards, presentations, written reports, webinars and one on one consultations with sales.
•	Analyze competitors’ announcements, product/solutions, services, partnerships, financial data and strategy to identify competitive threats and opportunities.
•	Provide competitive analysis in support of business development, product management, product marketing, and specific launch and announcement events
•	Keep current on all key competitors and related sources of competitive intelligence and data. These include but are not limited to IBM COS, Dell (ECS, ObjectScale, Isilon), Pure Storage FlashBlade, Scality, Cloudian, NetApp StorageGRID, Nutanix, VAST, Qumulo and others
•	Develop and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders to identify key needs and methods of delivering the right intelligence at the right time to the right person. This includes giving feedback back to Product Management, Product and Product Marketing to help inform the product roadmap.
•	Promote the use of competitive intelligence within the sales organization and other internal stakeholders.
•	Act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities, product launches, and trainings.
Job Location
•	Primary qualifications (include skills, years of experience, education, knowledge, etc.):
•	10-15 years experience in competitive intelligence, product management, presales or technical product marketing within the unstructured data, object and file storage industry. 
•	Competitive and market knowledge of unstructured data, file and object storage products, solutions and related services.
•	Strategic thinker who can synthesize and then communicate ideas, insights and recommendations in written or verbal form as well as present to small and large groups
•	Demonstrated inquisitive nature, desire to learn, and dig for information.
•	Highly skilled in using Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel and Word.
•	BA required.
•	Capability to work independently to manage multiple initiatives and projects simultaneously, exercising independent judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.

 
Our Company
Hitachi Vantara is part of the Global Hitachi family. We balance innovation with an open, friendly culture and the backing of a long-established parent company, known for its ethical reputation.  We guide customers from what’s now to what’s next by unlocking the value of their data and applications to solve their digital challenges, achieving outcomes that benefit both business and society.
Our people are our biggest asset, they drive our innovation advantage and we strive to offer a flexible and collaborative workplace where they can thrive.  Diversity of thought is welcomed and our employee base is represented by several active Employee Resource Group communities.  We offer industry leading benefits packages (flexible working, generous pension and private healthcare) and promote a creative and inclusive culture.  If driving real change gives you a sense of pride and you are passionate about powering social good, we’d love to hear from you.

Our Values
We strive to create an inclusive environment for all and are open to considering home working, compressed/flexible hours and flexible arrangements. Get in touch with us to explore how we might be able to accommodate your specific needs.
We are proud to say we are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  With Japanese roots going back over 100 years, our culture is founded on the values of our parent company expressed as the Hitachi Spirit:
Wa – Harmony, Trust, Respect
Makoto – Sincerity, Fairness, Honesty, Integrity
Kaitakusha-Seishin – Pioneering Spirit, Challenge

title: Sr. Competitive Marketing Analyst, Object and File Storage
content:
We’re Hitachi Vantara, a global infrastructure business. Our people are the force of meaningful progress. We enable the incredible with data – from taking theme park fans on magical rides, conserving natural resources, protecting rainforests to saving lives. We empower businesses to automate, optimize and advance innovation. Together, we create a sustainable future for all. 
Imagine the sheer breadth of talent it takes to inspire he future. We don’t expect you to ‘fit’ every requirement – your life experience, character, perspective, and passion for achieving great things in the world are equally important to us.The role
We are looking for a Senior Competitive Marketing Analyst to cover our unstructured data portfolio including object, file and partner products to enable and support our sales organization in competitive situations. They will also provide key internal stakeholders with actionable and impactful competitive data, insights and recommendation to drive our current business and strategy.
Reporting to the Senior Director of Strategic Marketing, the Senior Competitive Marketing Analyst will research competitors, customer data and intelligence, market trends, technology, and other forces to position Hitachi Vantara with the greatest possible competitive advantage. This is a competitive intelligence position with a primary focus on our unstructured data portfolio including object storage, file storage and related partner products.Job Overview:• Provide analysis of competitor’s market activities including positioning, strengths/weaknesses, competitive tactics and responses for field sales use. Deliver key insights and recommendations through battlecards, presentations, written reports, webinars and one on one consultations with sales.• Analyze competitors’ announcements, product/solutions, services, partnerships, financial data and strategy to identify competitive threats and opportunities.• Provide competitive analysis in support of business development, product management, product marketing, and specific launch and announcement events• Keep current on all key competitors and related sources of competitive intelligence and data. These include but are not limited to IBM COS, Dell (ECS, ObjectScale, Isilon), Pure Storage FlashBlade, Scality, Cloudian, NetApp StorageGRID, Nutanix, VAST, Qumulo and others• Develop and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders to identify key needs and methods of delivering the right intelligence at the right time to the right person. This includes giving feedback back to Product Management, Product and Product Marketing to help inform the product roadmap.• Promote the use of competitive intelligence within the sales organization and other internal stakeholders.• Act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities, product launches, and trainings.
What you’ll bring
• Primary qualifications (include skills, years of experience, education, knowledge, etc.):• 10-15 years experience in competitive intelligence, product management, presales or technical product marketing within the unstructured data, object and file storage industry.• Competitive and market knowledge of unstructured data, file and object storage products, solutions and related services.• Strategic thinker who can synthesize and then communicate ideas, insights and recommendations in written or verbal form as well as present to small and large groups• Demonstrated inquisitive nature, desire to learn, and dig for information.• Highly skilled in using Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel and Word.• BA required.• Capability to work independently to manage multiple initiatives and projects simultaneously, exercising independent judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.
As required by the equal pay and transparency acts, the expected base salary for this position is:
Tier One Location (including New York City and California Bay Area): $116,000 -$165,500
Tier Two Location (including Colorado, Seattle, and the rest of California): $101,000 - $144,000
Tier Three Location (including the rest of Washington State): $81,000 – $115,000
The expected pay is determined based on a variety of factors including, but not limited to, depth of experience in the practice area. Employees are eligible to participate in Hitachi Vantara’s bonus/variable/commission pay programs, where applicable, and are subject to the program’s conditions and restriction.
 
#LI-TPChampioning diversity, equity, and inclusion 
Diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) are integral to our culture and identity. Diverse thinking, a commitment to allyship, and a culture of empowerment help us achieve powerful results. We want you to be you, with all the ideas, lived experience, and fresh perspective that brings. We support your uniqueness and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our team.
How we look after you
We want to help you take care of your today and tomorrow – at home and at work. Which is why we offer industry-leading benefits that go far beyond compensation. That means support, services, and resources that also take care of your holistic health and wellbeing. We’re always looking for new ways of working that bring out our best, which leads to unexpected ideas. Here, you’ll experience a sense of belonging, and discover autonomy, freedom, and ownership as you work alongside talented people you enjoy sharing knowledge with. We’re also champions of life balance and offer flexible arrangements that work for you (role and location dependent).
About us
We’re a global team of innovators. Together, we harness engineering excellence and passion for insight to co-create meaningful solutions to complex challenges. We turn organizations into data-driven leaders that can a make positive impact on their industries and society. If you believe that innovation can inspire the future, this is the place to fulfil your purpose and achieve your potential.
We’re proud to say we’re an equal opportunity employer and welcome all applicants for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, age, disability status or any other protected characteristic. Should you need reasonable accommodations during the recruitment process, please let us know so that we can do our best to set you up for success.

demographic_questions.description:
At Hitachi Vantara, we value the diversity of our workforce and strive to foster an inclusive environment in which talent from all backgrounds can thrive, bringing their unique contributions to our culture and success. We are an equal opportunity employer and seek to strengthen our hiring practices by identifying and mitigating the potential for bias in our assessment and selection processes.

Below is a set of voluntary demographic questions that, if you choose to complete, will provide aggregated data to inform our hiring strategy and help us uphold our commitment to inclusive hiring.  Your responses, or choice to not respond, will in no way be linked to your specific application and will not be used to inform the hiring decision.

Our company does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or veteran status. In order to track the effectiveness of our recruiting efforts and ensure we consider the needs of all our employees, please consider the following optional questions.

answer_options.label: South Asian (For example, Bangladeshi, Bhutanese, Indian)
East Asian (For example - Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Filipino, Indonesian, Vietnamese)
Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

questions.label: Would you describe yourself as having a physical impairment or disability?
Do you consider yourself a member of the LGBTQIA+ community?

Current Address (Street Address, City, State, Country, Zip Code)
Are you legally authorized to work in the country where this job is located?
Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for employment?

Are you a citizen from one of the countries listed here?
(Needed to determine if export authorization is required).
If yes, do you have dual citizenship (i.e., a citizen of another country) or legal permanent residency in another country?
If yes, please list such country(ies) below. If no, respond "no"

questions.description:
Please click HERE to read the Hitachi Vantara Data Protection Privacy Statement. 

By checking the box labeled “I Consent” on this submission page and submitting my personal data to the Company, I confirm that I have read, understand, and consent to the terms and conditions, including those which are provided via hyperlinks on this page, in which my personal data will be processed by the Company.
questions.label: Data Protection Notification and Consent Form*

Do you currently, or have you ever worked for any company within the Hitachi Group? 
E.g., Hitachi Rail, Hitachi Energy etc.
If yes, please specify the Hitachi company name. If no, respond "no"
